questions.text: Who pulled a practical joke on Josh?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	Toby hired an actor's troupe to cause Josh problems on the morning that he was voting.

questions.text: Which staff member was made to go outside to spit and curse because he tempted wrath?
Toby didn't want to write a concession speech.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Toby wrote a speech for if they win and a speech if they lost so that he wouldn't 'tempt the wrath from high on top the thing'.

questions.text: Anthony's friend shared the same name as which city?
questions.explanation:
Orlando.

	Anthony brought his friend Orlando to the White House so Charlie could help him get out of a felony. Later, Josh ran into Orlando and fell in the floor. Because of Orlando's girth, Josh said he should play football.

Josh.

	Donna (to Josh): "Pumpkin-patch, is there anything I can do to get you to go to the movies for eight hours?"

questions.text: How much money did Toby want to bribe the nurse so Andy would have an easy second trimester?
questions.explanation:
$50.

	Josh: "It's your first. It's twins. I don't know. I'm thinking a hundred."

questions.text: According to Sam, how many people come before the Secretary of Agriculture in the line of Presidency?
questions.explanation:
18.

	Sam told this to Donna, but unless he was exaggerating he was wrong. The Secretary of Agriculture is tenth on the list of succession.

Will.

	Will: "I didn't know I could do that."

questions.text: Who played Lieutenant Commander Jack Reese?
questions.explanation:
Christian Slater.

	Donna met him outside a voting place.

questions.text: Did the President win New Hampshire?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Leo: "You're going to win New Hampshire."
